Title: Machine Learning Engineer (NLP) (all)
Description:
Let me introduce...

With Sonia, doctors are successful doctors. We create and deploy AI-enhanced solutions that make doctors‚Äô lives easier, patients‚Äô care better, and healthcare systems more efficient. If you‚Äôre an intrinsically motivated self-starter who values impactful work, join us in revolutionizing healthcare.

We‚Äôre looking for a Machine Learning Engineer (NLP) (all) to join our AI team to help advance the future of healthcare. You will work on speech recognition systems that power real-world applications used by clinicians every day.

This role can be performed in a hybrid setup from our offices in Luxembourg or Berlin, or remotely from anywhere in Germany or Luxembourg.

This Is What You‚Äôll Own


Model Optimization & Deployment: Fine-tune, evaluate, and deploy state-of-the-art NLP models.
NLP Application: Apply NLP methods for text processing and analysis.
MLOps Collaboration: Work with the MLOps team to ensure continuous training for models in production.
Experimentation: Design and conduct experiments to validate new methods.
Data Pipelining: Build and maintain language preprocessing workflows.
Cross-Functional Impact: Collaborate closely with product managers, other ML engineers, and developers to translate the solutions into production.


You‚Äôll thrive in this role if you bring

Must Haves


Education: Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field or equivalent industry experience.
Experience: Typically 5-8+ years of experience in ML engineering or related fields.
Technical Proficiency: Strong programming skills in Python and ML frameworks (PyTorch, Hugging Face Transformers, NLTK, spaCy).
NLP Specialization: Experience with deep learning language models, including transformers, NER, and tokenizers.
Production ML Experience: Experience with MLOps pipeline components (Docker, MLflow, W&B).


Nice to Have


Domain Knowledge: Knowledge of multilingual or domain-specific language modeling (medical/legal and other specialized fields).
Scalability: Experience with distributed training systems.
Orchestration: Knowledge of Kubernetes.
Language Skills: English full proficiency, German/French/Italian is a plus.


Why you‚Äôll love working with us


Full ownership of impactful ML components in a fast-growing AI environment.
A collaborative team that values curiosity, learning, and pragmatic problem-solving.
Flexible working arrangements (remote or hybrid).
30 days of annual vacation.
Competitive salary depending on experience.
The chance to work on products that directly shape the future of healthcare.


Ready to apply?

If you‚Äôre passionate about Machine Learning and want to make an impact in healthcare with cutting-edge AI technologies, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

I‚Äôm Margarita and will be guiding you through the application process.

About Us

At Sonia, we‚Äôre building more than just a product ‚Äî we‚Äôre building a team that helps doctors succeed with the power of AI. To grow and shape the future of healthcare, we‚Äôre looking for people who want to create, challenge, and collaborate ‚Äî and have fun while doing it.

We believe teams thrive when different perspectives come together and work toward a shared goal. We welcome and respect everyone for who they are, regardless of origin, gender, age, religion, disability, or sexual identity. We‚Äôre excited to meet people from all backgrounds who want to bring their unique perspective to our mission.

Are you in?

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - Talent Pool (m/f/d)
HTML:
Merantix Momentum is a Berlin-based AI startup focusing on accelerating AI adoption across many industries through B2B solutions, as well as publicly funded research projects. We work across several domains, including automotive, manufacturing, retail, healthcare and many more, transforming businesses as an external machine learning department. We achieve this using our core expertise in state-of-the-art machine learning combined with our culture of rapid iterations to build scalable solutions.

This is a talent pool position open to multiple seniority levels. We are building a strong pipeline of Machine Learning Engineers to connect with when opportunities arise at Merantix Momentum. By joining our talent pool, you'll be among the first to be considered when we have openings that match your profile

Aufgaben

  • Scoping machine learning projects and assessing their technical feasibility through client interaction;
  • Implementing machine learning methods and applying them to real-world use cases;
  • Contributing to the development and evolution of our internal AI stack and open source ecosystem;
  • Collaborating with data, backend, and frontend engineers to build production-ready AI solutions;
  • Driving machine learning projects from ideation through to the production phase.

Profil

Your profile

The ideal candidate is proficient in software engineering and the latest machine learning and deep learning technologies. You will independently scope, plan, manage, and drive machine learning projects from ideation to production.

You are a great fit for our team if this describes you:

  • MSc or PhD in computer science, Machine Learning, or related technical field;
  • Strong programming skills in Python with experience in Deep Learning tasks and libraries like PyTorch;
  • Experience with one or more cloud providers (Google Cloud Platform, AWS, Azure);
  • Proven ability to independently complete complex, real-world technical projects;
  • Experience in time series analysis and at least one of the following: Computer Vision and/or Natural Language Processing and/or Graph Neural Networks and/or Reinforcement Learning and/or Causal Inference;
  • Appreciation for sound engineering practices, including version control, clean code, code review, testing, CI/CD, and automation;
  • Strong ability to interact with clients, understand their problems, and design and explain complex technical solutions;
  • Fluency in English (German is a plus).

Wir bieten

What We Offer

  • We have a flexible work-from-home policy(hybrid);
  • Brand new office situated on the AI Campus in Berlin;
  • We offer Visa Sponsorship;
  • Hardware allowance. We give you support to have all the equipment you would need to thrive in your job;
  • International Team: within our current Team, we have more than 10 nationalities and counting;
  • We offer 50‚Ç¨ per employee per month that can be allocated as desired to one of the following: Mobility & transportation (NAVIT), sport (Urban Sports Club membership) or Edenred (Groceries);
  • Engaging Topics and Excellence: Merantix offers unique insights into applied machine learning research and development, working with a group of highly talented engineers and entrepreneurs.
  • Ethics: We are committed to developing ethical AI software;
  • Dynamic working culture: We hold weekly and monthly events around AI Innovation and Implementation. We have a flat hierarchy, open 360¬∞ feedback, and flexible working hours;
  • Learning and Development. Annual learning and development budget to attend conferences or purchase educational resources to further develop additional skills;

Apply for this job

About Us

We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity. We consider all applications equally regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity. We strongly encourage individuals from groups traditionally underrepresented in tech to apply, and we can help with immigration.

Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

LNKD1_DE

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
Digitalization and energy transition in one sentence? That‚Äôs what we do at Green Fusion!




Our software holistically optimizes energy systems in the real estate sector, helping to combat climate change through digitalization and automation. We reduce emissions and energy consumption, actively advancing the energy transition.


Tasks


As an ML Engineer, you‚Äôll support our Sector Coupling team building the next generation of intelligent Energy Management Systems (EMS). You will enable high-accuracy model predictions and optimizations through long-term learning from our data to save energy every single day.





You will design and improve machine learning models for time-series forecasting and nonlinear optimization, taking them from concept to deployment.


By working alongside data scientists and energy engineers, you will bring forecasting and optimization models into our EMS production environment (Cloud and Edge).


Maintain and improve ML pipelines (using tools like Prefect and MLFlow) to support the full model lifecycle‚Äîfrom experiment tracking to training and validation.


Act as the guardian of our data. You ensure feature engineering for time-series, asset telemetry, and market data is robust. You also lead the monitoring of model quality, handling concept drift and performance evaluation.


Lead the development of digital twins and simulation environments to safely test how our EMS interacts with components before they touch real hardware.


You will collaborate with embedded and platform teams to integrate your work into the GreenBox edge device and backend services.



Requirements


We know that nobody fits a job description 100%. If you see yourself in most of these points and are passionate about our mission, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!





You bring a strong background in Python and machine learning engineering, with hands-on experience developing, testing, and maintaining models in containerized production environments (e.g., Docker, AWS).


You are familiar with the full machine-learning lifecycle, from training to deployment and monitoring, and you have experience using MLOps tools such as Prefect, MLflow, or similar platforms.


You have experience in time-series forecasting and nonlinear optimization, and ideally you‚Äôve worked with stochastic model predictive control or probabilistic forecasting techniques.


You are curious about how physical and energy systems work, from heat pumps to power markets, and you recognize the importance of validating algorithms that control real-world hardware.


You enjoy collaborating with cross-functional teams (Energy, Backend, Embedded) and can clearly communicate technical concepts to diverse stakeholders.


Bonus Points: You bring experience with Reinforcement Learning, IoT/Edge deployments, or energy management systems (EMS)‚Äîa plus, but not a must.



Benefits


üè† Flexible working hour models, home office, and remote work.




üí° Ongoing training opportunities ‚Äì whether through job challenges, our open feedback culture, or sponsored training programs, there are always opportunities to learn and grow.




üíº Employee benefits such as Urban Sports Club or Become1.




üå± Direct impact through your job ‚Äì with us, you can actively contribute to the energy transition and fight against climate change every day.




üíö We value our team ‚Äì that's why regular team events are very important to us.




üôå The best team that Berlin has to offer ‚Äì and maybe even beyond. Don‚Äôt believe it? Then find out for yourself and apply now!




---




While we are still considered pioneers today, we can soon dominate the market with you! First in the DACH region, then throughout Europe.




You can expect a motivated, open-minded, and dynamic environment that is passionate and ambitious about actively shaping the energy transition ‚Äì a goal that can only be achieved together!




We look forward to your application ‚Äì Fernanda will get in touch with you!

Show more

While we are still considered pioneers today, we can soon dominate the market with you! First in the DACH region, then throughout Europe.


You can expect a motivated, open-minded, and dynamic environment that is passionate and ambitious about actively shaping the energy transition ‚Äì a goal that can only be achieved together!


We look forward to your application ‚Äì Fernanda will get in touch with you!
